name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: I‚Äôve lived that dream, and I‚Äôm making it my mission to open doors of opportunity and make dreams like that a reality for all New Yorkers.  Because whether you‚Äôve been here five months, or five years, or five generations, it‚Äôs on all of us to keep that New York Dream alive.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: You know, when a young boy like me can be raised in Harlem without much money, work hard, get a good education and now have the honor to serve as Lieutenant Governor, that is the New York we can all believe in.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: And Governor @KathyHochul and I are passing historic criminal justice reform into law while simultaneously working closely with Mayors and law enforcement officials across the state to keep New Yorkers safe.¬†We can and we will have both public safety and justice.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: We‚Äôre creating teams of mental health professionals to engage the homeless, investing $400 million to help address opioid addiction, and are rolling out a $25 billion housing plan including $400 million to promote home ownership among low-and-middle income families.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: To the New Yorkers who are experiencing homelessness or addiction, or who are struggling with mental health issues, or just can‚Äôt make the rent, I want you to know: we are fighting for you.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: I‚Äôm proud of what Governor Hochul and I are doing to help New Yorkers. But let‚Äôs be real, the last two years have been tough, and there‚Äôs still so much more to be done.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: And it‚Äôs why we recently announced $900 million in childcare stabilization grants, because New Yorkers should not have to worry about choosing between their job and taking care of their kids.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: She didn‚Äôt miss a shift during the pandemic, even with 3 kids in online school at home.  NOT ONE SHIFT.¬†  It‚Äôs nurses like Alizia who are why our Administration is investing $10 billion dollars to give healthcare workers bonuses and to hire more people over the next five years.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: When the pandemic hit New York hard and fast two years ago, many had to stay home.¬†But it was nurses like my neighbor Alizia who kept going to work, providing life-saving treatment to New Yorkers who were suffering from this scary and mysterious new virus.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: We‚Äôre fighting for Long Islanders like Peter, a union worker who catches the 4:30AM train every day. Families like his are why we‚Äôre investing in our infrastructure and growing our green economy, because we need to fight the climate crisis and create thousands of good union jobs.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: New Yorkers like Karim from Buffalo.   When the pandemic hit, he had to shut his restaurant down. But he adapted and he persevered. That‚Äôs what New Yorkers do.¬†  And that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre investing $250 million for pandemic relief for our small businesses.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: But right now that dream feels like it‚Äôs out of reach for far too many New Yorkers, or has been put on hold or put in jeopardy because of the pandemic.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: And my parents‚Äô story shows what‚Äôs so beautiful about the New York Dream.¬†It‚Äôs not about who‚Äôs the richest or most powerful.  It‚Äôs about building a state where New Yorkers, no matter their zip code, have the opportunity to unlock their God-given talents.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: My parents have lived the New York Dream. That‚Äôs the hope Governor Hochul and I have for all New Yorkers and their families.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: My step-dad Alvin came here from Jamaica and worked as a bus driver in Canarsie, taking night shifts at a local grocery store. My parents got up early every day. They worked hard. And they taught me that I needed to be twice as good as everyone else to be successful.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: 47 years ago, my mom Yvonne packed up her suitcase in Guyana and moved to New York with next to nothing. She picked up temp jobs until the unemployment office sent her to Local 372 at DC37 when I was just three months old.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: That‚Äôs what New York has always meant to me. It‚Äôs a place where anyone should be able to work hard and make a better life for themselves and their family. My family‚Äôs story is that New York Dream.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: It is an honor to work with such a determined leader to tackle these problems while building a brighter future for New York where everyone has a seat at the table and has a chance to live out and achieve their wildest dreams.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: You know, when Governor @KathyHochul took office, she immediately faced historic challenges.  The Delta variant, the Omicron variant, back-to-back severe storms, owners and renters in serious financial debt due to the pandemic relief backlog, and so much more.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: I‚Äôm making it my mission as Lieutenant Governor to ensure all New Yorkers have a fair shot and a seat at the table, especially those who have been historically left out and left behind.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: We‚Äôre investing $1 billion to support small businesses and $350 million in workforce development, because these are the kinds of investments that help make sure Black New Yorkers can access the skills, resources, and support they need to start a small business or get a good job.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: And we recently announced that New York State‚Äôs utilization rate for Minority-and-Women-Owned businesses is over 30%, the highest rate in the country. Our FY2023 budget includes $11 million in new funding for the MWBE program.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: We‚Äôre significantly investing in promoting affordable home ownership, including $400 million to help increase home ownership for low-and-moderate-income New York families.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: These inequities run deep in our system. Policies from redlining to hiring discrimination have created generational cycles of wealth inequality. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm proud that our Administration is tackling this head on with a bold agenda.

name: Brian Benjamin
tweet: Let the beginning of #BlackHistoryMonth be a reminder that as leaders we're called upon to deliver policy solutions that rectify the systemic inequities that have harmed Black communities in New York and across the country.
